param.label: --version
param.help: show program's version number and exit

param.label: --help
param.help: show this help message and exit

param.label: --noopt
param.help: no optimization, just use free parameters as is (after a projection on feasibility domain), to calculate dependent fluxes, cumomers, stats and so on

param.label: --noscale
param.help: no scaling factors to optimize => all scaling factors are assumed to be 1

param.label: --meth
param.help: method for optimization, one of nlsic|BFGS|Nelder-Mead. Default: nlsic

param.label: --fullsys
param.help: calculate all cumomer set (not just the reduced one necesary to simulate measurements)

param.label: --emu
param.help: simulate labeling in EMU approach

param.label: --irand
param.help: ignore initial approximation for free parameters (free fluxes and metabolite concentrations) from the FTBL file or from a dedicated file (cf --fseries and --iseries option) and use random values drawn uniformly from [0,1] interval

param.label: --sens
param.help: sensitivity method: SENS can be 'mc[=N]', mc stands for Monte-Carlo. N is an optional number of Monte-Carlo simulations. Default for N: 10

param.label: --cupx
param.help: upper limit for reverse fluxes. Must be in interval [0, 1]. Default: 0.999

param.label: --cupn
param.help: absolute limit for net fluxes: -cupn <= netflux <= cupn. Must be non negative. Value 0 means no limit. Default: 1.e3

param.label: --cupp
param.help: upper limit for metabolite pool. Default: 1.e5

param.label: --clownr
param.help: lower limit for not reversible free and dependent fluxes. Zero value (default) means no lower limit

param.label: --cinout
param.help: lower limit for input/output free and dependent fluxes. Must be non negative. Default: 0

param.label: --clowp
param.help: lower limit for free metabolite pools. Must be positive. Default 1.e-8

param.label: --np
param.help: When integer >= 1, it is a number of parallel subprocesses used in Monte-Carlo (MC) simulations or for multiple FTBL inputs. When NP is a float number between 0 and 1, it gives a fraction of available cores (rounded to closest integer) to be used. Without this option or for NP=0, all available cores in a given node are used for MC simulations.

param.label: --ln
param.help: Least norm solution is used for increments during the non-linear iterations when Jacobian is rank deficient

param.label: --sln
param.help: Least norm of the solution of linearized problem (and not just of increments) is used when Jacobian is rank deficient

param.label: --tikhreg
param.help: Approximate least norm solution is used for increments during the non-linear iterations when Jacobian is rank deficient

param.label: --lim
param.help: The same as --ln but with a function limSolve::lsei()

param.label: --zc
param.help: Apply zero crossing strategy with non negative threshold for net fluxes

param.label: --ffguess
param.help: Don't use free/dependent flux definitions from FTBL file(s). Make an automatic guess.

param.label: --fseries
param.help: File name with free parameter values for multiple starting points. Default: '' (empty, i.e. only one starting point from the FTBL file is used)

param.label: --iseries
param.help: Indexes of starting points to use. Format: '1:10' -- use only first ten starting points; '1,3' -- use the the first and third starting points; '1:10,15,91:100' -- a mix of both formats is allowed. Default: '' (empty, i.e. all provided starting points are used)

param.label: --seed
param.help: Integer (preferably a prime integer) used for reproducible random number generating. It makes reproducible random starting points (--irand) but also Monte-Carlo simulations for sensitivity analysis. Default: none, i.e. current system value is used, so random drawing will be varying at each run.

param.label: --excl_outliers
param.help: This option takes an optional argument, a p-value between 0 and 1 which is used to filter out measurement outliers. The filtering is based on Z statistics calculated on reduced residual distribution. Default: 0.01.

param.label: --nocalc
param.help: generate an R code but not execute it.

param.label: --addnoise
param.help: Add centered gaussian noise to simulated measurements written to _res.kvh file. SD of this noise is taken from FTBL file

param.label: --time_order
param.help: Time order for ODE solving (1 (default), 2 or 1,2). Order 2 is more precise but more time consuming. The value '1,2' makes to start solving the ODE with the first order scheme then continues with the order 2.

param.label: --copy_doc
param.help: copy documentation directory in the current directory and exit. If ./doc exists, its content is silently owerriten.

param.label: --copy_test
param.help: copy test directory in the current directory and exit. If ./test exists, its content is silently owerriten.

param.label: --install_rdep
param.help: install R dependencies and exit.

param.label: --TIMEIT
param.help: developer option: measure cpu time or not

param.label: --prof
param.help: developer option: do time profiling or not

param.label: --tblimit
param.help: developer option: set trace back limit for python error messages
